briefTitle: Effect of Vildagliptin vs. Glibenclamide on Circulating Endothelial Progenitor Cell Number Type 2 Diabetes
officialTitle: Randomized, Open Label, Two Parallel Arms, Intervention Trial Comparing the Effect of DPP-IV Inhibitor Vildagliptin vs. Glibenclamide on Circulating Endothelial Progenitor Cell Number in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Metformin Failure
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of Dipeptidyl peptidase (DPP) -IV inhibitor Vildagliptin vs. Glibenclamide on circulating endothelial progenitor cells (EPCs) number in type 2 diabetes patients in metformin failure. Subjects will be followed for 12 months after randomization.

primaryOutcome.measure: Absolute Change in the Endothelial Progenitor Cell (EPC) Number
